author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Second Additional Sessions Court Judge, T. Jeyarajan, on Tuesday sentenced a man accused of murder to undergo life imprisonment, concurrently. According to prosecution, M. Japan alias Shanmugaiah (52) of Anna Nagar in Thoothukudi was found guilty of murdering Vembuthagam (30), wife of Boopathy on April 3 in 2013. It was a murder for gain.

Shanmugaiah, the accused, who promised her a job, took her to Mela Pandiyapuram near Maniyachi, strangled her to death and took away her jewels worth Rs. 67,500 and fled the scene. The incident occurred in a remote locality in Mela Pandiyapuram.

Maniyachi police filed a case following the incident. The accused was punished under Section 302 (murder) of IPC, and sentenced to life along with a fine of Rs. 1,000. He was also punished under Section 392 (robbery) of IPC, for which he was ordered to undergo a seven year rigorous imprisonment. A fine of Rs.1, 000 was also imposed on him. He ordered that the two sentences should run concurrently. Additional Public Prosecutor A.V. Muthu was present.

The accused promised the victim a job, took her to Mela Pandiyapuram, strangled her and took her jewels
title: Man gets life term for murder
